channel.title: Mysql DB
channel.description:
hay i would like to know what should i use for the following in my DB
id< 100 numbers/letters body <= unlimited letters/numbers/.;'[]}{)*(^&*£$%£"!£
what should i use and how should i set it up as in the nulls and all that
thanks

item.title: Mysql DB
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

thanks if i get stuck ill post here[br][size=1]Posted on: March 11, 2007, 05:31:40 AM[/size][hr]what would the SQL query be? i find that easer at the mo i just don’t want to get it wrong =p sorry
is this it?

CREATE TABLE `submit` (
`tutid` TINYINT( 3 ) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY ,
`body` TEXT NOT NULL
) ENGINE = innodb;

p.s what would the username and password be?[br][size=1]Posted on: March 11, 2007, 05:41:12 AM[/size][hr]now i need another one which will be title

so…
id
title
body

Read full topic

item.title: Mysql DB
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

i assume you’re using phpmyadmin, so create a new table with 2 fields,
in the first row, enter in the first textbox id, change varchar to tinyint and value to 3, then go to extra and select auto_increment, then, look for the primary key radio button, and click it.
for the body:
enter in the second row in the first textbox: body, and then change varchar to text

Read full topic
